name: 'King of the Hill' - Hank Hill Online Quiz | Television | 10 Questions
tags: 'King Of The Hill' - Characters and Actors

questions.text: Hank Hill is one of the main characters from the television show 'King of the Hill'.  Name the show's co-creator, and the voice behind this very lovable animated character!
questions.explanation:
Mike Judge.

	Mike Judge, who created 'Beavis and Butthead', and also directed the cult classic film 'Office Space', is the genius behind 'King of the Hill', and the voice of Hank Hill.  Mike Judge based Hank Hill's personality on his own father. Did you know that Mike Judge has a B.S. in Physics from the University of California, San Diego?

questions.text: Hank Hill lives with his family in Arlen, Texas.  Which of these members of the 'King of the Hill' cast of characters is not related in some way to Hank?
questions.explanation:
Joseph.

	Peggy is Hank Hill's wife, while Bobby is his quirky son.  Luanne is Hank's niece, on Peggy's side.  She has come to live with the Hills, as her parents have relinquished their responsibilities for her.  Joseph is the son of wacky neighbor Dale Gribble.

questions.text: Though Hank Hill is a proud member of the Arlen community, and a devoted Texan, he was not born in that state.  Rather, he was born in a much larger American city, but which one?
questions.explanation:
New York City.

	Hank learns in one episode that his mother gave birth to him in a bathroom at Yankee Stadium.  It seems that the Hills were visiting New York City at the time because Cotton Hill, Hank's father, intended to kill visiting foreign dignitary Fidel Castro.

questions.text: Hank's obnoxious, war-hero father Cotton is a frequent guest on the show.  Hank's mother, who has been divorced from Cotton, has also appeared in several episodes.  What is his mother's given name?
questions.explanation:
Tilly.

	Tilly Mae Hill was voiced in her first appearance by none other than country music superstar Tammy Wynette!  In later episodes, she was voiced by Beth Grant and K. Callan.  Tilly is a very sweet lady, quite the opposite of her ex-husband.  She's fond of glass miniatures.

questions.text: What fuel, and its related accessories, does Hank Hill proudly sell at his place of work, a company owned by Buck Strickland?
questions.explanation:
Propane.

	Hank is a propane salesman.  He was once the manager of Strickland Propane, but lost the job when he confessed his love to Buck Strickland (in a purely Platonic sense, of course).  Propane and propane accessories are Hank's true love, well, after his family of course!

questions.text: Hank is a fan of various sports, but none more so than football.  In fact, during high school he played in the state championship.  What professional football team is Hank's favorite?
questions.explanation:
Dallas Cowboys.

	Hank is a fan of most of the professional teams in Texas, but he does have a preference for the teams from Dallas, and in particular, his beloved Dallas Cowboys.  Hank idolizes Tom Landry, the former coach of the Cowboys.  Hank is not a big fan of the city of Houston, thus why he prefers the Dallas teams.

questions.text: Hank Hill suffers from a number of mild physical handicaps.  Which of these is among the most severe?
questions.explanation:
Diminished Gluteal Syndrome.

	In one episode, Hank's Diminished Gluteal Syndrome (or DGS) is diagnosed by a doctor who then provides Hank with 'orthogluteal' prosthetics.  In other episodes, another of Hank's physical problems is mentioned, namely his 'narrow urethra', which has limited him to one child.  Another odd syndrome that Hank suffered, blindness after having viewed his mother and a man in an unmentionable situation!

questions.text: Hank Hill is purely a pickup truck man, no average car will do.  What make of truck is the only one that Hank Hill says he will drive?
questions.explanation:
Ford.

	Hank Hill in a foreign truck?  Never!  He is purely a Ford man.  Hank's original truck was a Ford Ranger, but that one finally broke down (and was subsequently crushed by a train).  Thereafter, he would drive in his new F-250.  Red is the color of choice for Mr. Hill.

questions.text: In a one episode, it is revealed that Hank has a half brother.  In what country was Hank's half brother born?
questions.explanation:
Japan.

	Cotton Hill had an affair with a Japanese woman during World War II, and the result was Hank's older brother Junichiro.  Junichiro was voice by David Carradine, of 'Kung Fu' fame, and he also suffers with a 'narrow urethra'.

questions.text: Hank Hill has numerous skills, including some musical ability.  What musical instrument does Hank play?
questions.explanation:
Guitar.

	Hank Hill is a guitar man, and it is revealed in an early episode that he idolizes Willie Nelson, who he actually gets to meet!  In another episode, Hank plays his guitar in a bluegrass band with Bobby's friend Connie (who plays the fiddle). I hope you enjoyed this quiz about one of TV's most entertaining dads.  Thank you for playing!
